item.title: Setting up an IPv6 Tunnel with OpenBSD
item.description: Though IPv6 has been around for quite some time, its adoption is still not as widespread as IPv4. While IPv6 offers an almost unlimited number of addresses, support from major ISPs remains limited. One way to enable IPv6 at home is by using a tunnel broker like Hurricane Electric, which provides a routable IPv6 prefix to your home network. In this guide, weâ€™ll configure an IPv6 tunnel on OpenBSD 7.5, using it as a home router.
